blocks.name: cupwlks
blocks.content: Extend class notation with walks (of a pseudograph).

blocks.name: df-upwlks
blocks.content: Define the set of all walks (in a pseudograph), called "simple walks" in the following. According to Wikipedia ("Path (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Path_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A walk of length k in a graph is an alternating sequence of vertices and edges, v0 , e0 , v1 , e1 , v2 , ... , v(k-1) , e(k-1) , v(k) which begins and ends with vertices. If the graph is undirected, then the endpoints of e(i) are v(i) and v(i+1)." According to Bollobas: " A walk W in a graph is an alternating sequence of vertices and edges x0 , e1 , x1 , e2 , ... , e(l) , x(l) where e(i) = x(i-1)x(i), 0<i<=l.", see Definition of [Bollobas] p. 4. Therefore, a walk can be represented by two mappings f from { 1 , ... , n } and p from { 0 , ... , n }, where f enumerates the (indices of the) edges, and p enumerates the vertices. So the walk is represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n). Although this definition is also applicable for arbitrary hypergraphs, it allows only walks consisting of not proper hyperedges (i.e. edges connecting at most two vertices). Therefore, it should be used for pseudograhs only. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 28-Dec-2020.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-upwlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  |- wceq(cupwlks, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, w3a(wcel(cv(s1), cword(cdm(cfv(ciedg, cv(s0))))), wf(cv(s2), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(s1))), cfv(cvtx, cv(s0))), wral(s3, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(s1))), wceq(cfv(cfv(ciedg, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3))), cpr(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s3)), cfv(cv(s2), co(cv(s3), caddc, nat1)))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
}

axiom df-upwlks(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3) {
  ‚ä¢ UPWalks =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s1, s2 > |(s1 ‚àà Word(dom((iEdg ` s0)))‚àß(s2 :(0[...](# ` s1))‚Üí(Vtx ` s0))‚àß ‚àÄ(s3 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` s1)),((iEdg ` s0)`(s1 ` s3))= {(s2 ` s3),(s2 `(s3[+]1))}))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
}

blocks.content: The set of simple walks (in an undirected graph). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 28-Dec-2020.)

  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà c1 ‚Üí(UPWalks ` c0)= { < s0, s1 > |(s0 ‚àà Word(dom(c2))‚àß(s1 :(0[...](# ` s0))‚Üí c3)‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` s0)),(c2 `(s0 ` s2))= {(s1 ` s2),(s1 `(s2[+]1))}))})

} = {
  fvmptd3(hs0, cupwlks, c0, { < s0, s1 > |(s0 ‚àà Word(dom(c2))‚àß(s1 :(0[...](# ` s0))‚Üí c3)‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` s0)),(c2 `(s0 ` s2))= {(s1 ` s2),(s1 `(s2[+]1))}))}, universe, { < s0, s1 > |(s0 ‚àà Word(dom((iEdg ` hs0)))‚àß(s1 :(0[...](# ` s0))‚Üí(Vtx ` hs0))‚àß ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà(0[..^](# ` s0)),((iEdg ` hs0)`(s0 ` s2))= {(s1 ` s2),(s1 `(s2[+]1))}))}, universe, c0 ‚àà c1)

  eqeq1d(((iEdg ` hs0)`(s0 ` s2)), {(s1 ` s2),(s1 `(s2[+]1))}, (c2 `(s0 ` s2)), hs0 = c0)

  mp1i(c0 ‚àà c1, Word(dom(c2))‚àà ùïå, dom(c2)‚àà ùïå)
  dmex(c2)

thm isupwlkg(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wbr(c2, cfv(cupwlks, c0), c3), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))))))

} = {
  pm5.21ndd(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cfv(cupwlks, c0), c3), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))), w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))

  brfvopab(hs0, hs1, c2, cupwlks, c0, c3, w3a(wcel(cv(hs0), cword(cdm(c4))), wf(cv(hs1), co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, cv(hs0))), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(cv(hs1), cv(s0)), cfv(cv(hs1), co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))))
  upwlksfval(hs0, hs1, s0, c0, universe, c4, c5)

  ex(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))), wa(wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe))))
  anim12i(wcel(c0, c1), w3a(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1)))))), wcel(c0, universe), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  elex(c0, c1)
  3adant3(wcel(c2, cword(cdm(c4))), wf(c3, co(nat0, cfz, cfv(chash, c2)), c5), wral(s0, co(nat0, cfzo, cfv(chash, c2)), wceq(cfv(c4, cfv(c2, cv(s0))), cpr(cfv(c3, cv(s0)), cfv(c3, co(cv(s0), caddc, nat1))))), wa(wcel(c2, universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
